measured_by: decision weights estimated with the adapted Confidence Weighted Majority Voting (CWMV) model
justification: "Using maximum likelihood estimation, a set of decision weights was estimated for each participant... The weight vectors can thus act as a quantitative measure of the dynamics by which information is exchanged in the group."

measured_by: cosine distance between each participant’s weight vector in noise vs. quiet
justification: "The first summary statistic, overall weight change, was quantified as (w_i^noise, w_i^quiet)... this statistic inherently measures the distance between conditions."

measured_by: angular distance between a participant’s weight vector and their own axis (w_i , ê_i)
justification: "The second statistic, self-weighting, was defined using the relative weight towards oneself, i.e. (w_i, ê_i) for the self-weighting of some group member."
construct: Self-weighting (reliance on one’s own prior information)

measured_by: distance between a participant’s weight vector and the uniform weight vector [1 1 1]
justification: "The third summary statistic used was weight equality. Defining the uniform weight û = [1 1 1], the distance (w_i, û) was used to quantify any given weights' distance to this uniform weighting."

measured_by: cosine distance between pairs of participants’ weight vectors (w_a , w_b)
justification: "The fourth and final summary statistic used was weight similarity. Weight similarity was quantified by the distance between the weights of each pair of individuals in a group, i.e. (w_a, w_b), (w_a, w_c) and (w_b, w_c)."
